column4: jentsu: Yes, when it comes to the partitioning stage of the install select manual installation
jentsu: apologies should have read ...select manually partition
okay, thanks. Is that going to be too terribly difficult to figure out?
manually partitioning, that is?
Is that it?
Thanks... That sounds much easier than I expected.
just one further thing to mention ...you need to partitions minimum / and swap
Wish I could type! That should read "two partitions minimum"
oh, okay. Well, since I already tried installing it but it messed up after that stage, there should already be both of those partitions, yes?
you might try breaking that partition in to two. Or you could try dooglus's approach
How would I split it up, as far as size distribution goes?
Well, first you delete it
Then you create a new partition.
Say the partition you delete was 10gb, you create the new one to be 9gb
And then you create another partition and use the rest of the free space
so for a 50gb partition, I should split it as 45/5, or 49/1?
They generally say create a swap partition that 1.5 to 2 times the size of your RAM
As dli says. In my case I have 1024 so I create a 2gb swap. It could be less I know, but since I have an 80gb HDD I ain't too worried about space
How much RAM do you have?
The one that says "user memory"
Ok, you probably want to create a swap partition up to about 1gb then
Have you backed up your "important" files. Just in case!
And you might want to have a look at this website. Just a bit more background. http://users.bigpond.net.au/hermanzone/
You are welcome. Best of luck!
